title: Law enforcement informal and formal settlement data and reports

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Law enforcement informal and formal settlement data and reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Materials related to and sufficient to show all instances of alleged and actual inappropriate or illegal behavior or actions resulting in compensation or expenditures involving this agency.

Responsive materials include records of all settlements (formal and informal) and payments to which this agency was or is a party for the period from January 1, 2010 through the date this request is processed. Responsive materials include those for matters and legal claims resolved prior to the initiation of any litigation.

In particular, materials responsive to this request include all reports, lists, databases, spreadsheets, and other documentation detailing incidents of legal claims or other allegations requiring compensation for claimants, attorneys, or any other party.

If spreadsheets or similar documents are available in response to this request, please provide all segregable data, including but not limited to:

The nature of the claim or legal matter
The claimant and other parties involved
The relevant case and tracking numbers for court and internal systems
The date the lawsuit was served or litigation commenced
The final disposition or current status of the case, including whether a case is still pending
The amount spent to date as a result of the legal engagement
The amount paid to any parties related to the legal claim, including any city payout and any non-monetary compensation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All discovery material from the Mark Sievers homicide case, which occurred in June 2015. 

 I have been informed by Communications Director Samantha Syoen that "This case is extremely large and the cost to you for the entire case would be a lot of money and a long time to complete." Ms. Syoen also informed me there is no table of contents or index for any of this material. 

   However, Mr. Sievers' attorney has also requested copies of these files, and apparently the state has prepared a hard drive that contains all the records to be transmitted.

 I would like to obtain EITHER a copy of the hard drive containing these records, OR a substantive index which would allow me to locate and request copies of the particular documents I need.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mikita Brottman

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All external and internal documents, emails, minutes and video/audio recordings since January 1, 2014 to present regarding the  Land Use Code re-write and proposal. Including but not limited to internal and external emails regarding the Land Use Code re-write, interaction with Kendig Keast Collaborative, City Council meetings, City Council workshops, Planning & Zoning Commission meetings, special or joint meetings, Planning & Zoning workshops, Citizen Advisory Committee meetings or any other meetings that were held in regards to the Land Use Code re-write.

<^^^>This is included because this request was done by someone anonymously three years ago, it has been ignored for three years, I ran across it, and if you need a name... well, you've got mine now. Add any contact reports or messages to that above request, such as phone logs, activity logs, journal entries, electronic calendars, text messages, or other metadata from cell phone text messages. These should be prioritized in order of release fastest to longest term, not held until all documentation is in, and sent / priced accordingly. In other words, if it's easier to aggregate and price and send one of the items first, then price and send it separately rather than wait for the entire package to be sent at one time.

2.    I also want all external and internal documents, emails, minutes, working papers and video/audio recordings since January 1, 2019 to present regarding the assignment of persons to the Zoning Administrator position (referred to as 6.24 in the Cortez code)also to include hiring criteria, job descriptions, job description changes, compensation descriptions, internal memos between staff about candidates for positions, the candidates for those positions who did not get hired, contract planners. (a)	Zoning Administrator. There is created an official administrative position known as the zoning administrator. The zoning administrator shall be the city planner and shall be appointed by, directed by, and serve at the pleasure of the city manager, except in such cases as noted in Section 2.02 of this code..." Additionally, please generate a document citing who held the position and at what times for the 6.24 Zoning Administrator.

title: State rep emails and text messages

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: State rep emails and text messages
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

This particular gathering involved the active participation of State Representative Lance Yednock and Staff Sergeant Murray, who met with representatives from the City of Lasalle at a public library on June 8th 2023. It is crucial to highlight that the said meeting was recorded through the meticulous note-taking skills of Staff Sergeant Murry. I would like the hand writing notes that I'm told were taken by Staff Sergeant Murray ,emails, phone calls and text messages. Any communication with city officials between lance yednock and staff sergeant murry In addition to this, I am fervently requesting the provision of any relevant and pertinent information that bears upon Carus Chemicals, situated at the address 1500 8th Street, LaSalle, Illinois, along with all documentation regarding the Apollo Warehouse for the period extending from January 11th to the current date. Moreover, I humbly seek your assistance in retrieving copies of any and all forms of communication, be it text messages, emails, or social media engagements, exchanged between Murry and Jamie Hicks, whose telephone number is 815/343-2396, exclusively for the period spanning from January 25th, 2023, to February 25th, 2023Jamie Hicks

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

jamie hicks

title: Richard "Lowtax" Kyanka (FBI)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Richard "Lowtax" Kyanka (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI Files on Richard "Lowtax" Kyanka, founder of the internet forum "Something Awful." 

I have attached proof of death. 

As per my understanding of the FBI's FOIA policies, please expand your search to include both main and reference files.

I am making this request in my capacity as a journalist who has written extensively about government transparency, including several books on the FBI specifically. As such, I am not requesting a fee waiver, but I am requesting I be placed in the media requester category.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JPat Brown

title: Request to Department of Defense for list of 2021 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Department of Defense for list of 2021 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the Department of Defense, inclusive of all branches of the military, has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2021. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports.  I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to Navy for list of 2022 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Navy for list of 2022 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the U.S. Navy has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2022. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports.  I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called the Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting a Kentucky Open Records Act (KORA) request seeking access to specific documents related to your department's activities for the two-month period preceding today, from August 3, 2023, to October 3, 2023. Specifically, I am requesting:

1. All records of KORA requests sent to your department during the specified two-month period.
2. All records of KORA responses issued by your department in response to external requests within the same timeframe.
3. A copy of the fee schedule for processing KORA requests and any associated costs.
4. A copy of your department's open records policy for reference.
5.Correspondence in relationship to KORA requests sent between government entities.

Please include details such as dates, requestors' names, and request contents in the KORA records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Louisiana Public Records Act Request: Louisiana Parish Prison Visitation, Telephone, Video Policies/Reports (Jefferson Parish Sheriff)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana Public Records Act Request: Louisiana Parish Prison Visitation, Telephone, Video Policies/Reports (Jefferson Parish Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any and all policies, procedures, directives, or equivalent guiding materials regarding the visitation of individuals not in custody of this agency.

2. Any and all policies, procedures, directives, or equivalent guiding materials regarding the use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other telecommunications and electronic communication by individuals in the custody of this agency.

3. Any and all open or active bidding or Requests for Proposal regarding the provision, installation, maintenance, or use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other electronic communication and telecommunication services.

4. Any and all active contracts regarding the provision, installation, maintenance, or use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other electronic communication and telecommunication services. Please include all associated supplemental materials, including any and all attachments and exhibits. Please provide any other materials regarding the terms of service.

5. Any and all financial reports or invoices related to the provision, installation, maintenance, or use of telephones, video conferencing equipment, or other electronic communication and telecommunication services. Please include all usage, commission, and fee reports, providing as much segregable data as possible.

6. All communications for the period from  December 1, 2022 through May 1, 2023 between this agency or any representative thereof and any prison telecommunications company or organization, including but not limited to Securus Technologies, Inc. and its subsidiary JPay.

7. All communications for the period from  December 1, 2022 through May 1, 2023 between this agency or any representative thereof and any representative of the Louisiana Public Service Commission.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Reagan Ross

Dear Christa Miller: The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/  The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt.  Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 10/3/2023 and given the reference number P013291-100323 for tracking purposes.

title: FBI: Katharine Sergava

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Katharine Sergava
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records mentioning or pertaining to the dancer and actress KATHARINE SERGAVA (aka KATHARINE SERGAVA SZNYCER aka KATHRYN SERGAVA). SERGAVA was born on July 30 1910 in Tbilisi, Georgia and died on November 26th of 2005 in New York City.  

https://www.nytimes.com/2003/12/04/arts/katharine-sergava-the-star-of-oklahoma-ballet-dies.html

Proof of death is not necessary as her death was widely reported in the media. Of particular interest would include, but not be limited to: bureau records related to her work with the United Service Organizations or any correspondence between SERGAVA and director Hoover. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Katharine Sergava. 

Please include a survey of records at the Miami field office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Sergava.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All recordings, including but not limited to, correspondence, reports, or analysis of public safety threats to the Cambridge Public Library's  "Outdoor Story Time with Drag Kings, Queens and Friends" that occurred on June 4, 2022 and records of any police detail assigned to the event.

title: Clearview AI contracts and policies

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Clearview AI contracts and policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Materials describing this agency's relationship with and use of products by Clearview AI, a face recognition company.

CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS
Any and all agreements related to the acquisition and use of this "software," algorithm, or program. This includes (but is not limited to):
• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• data sharing agreements
• insurance agreements
• intergovernmental services agreements
• licensing agreements
• memorandums of understanding, and
• nondisclosure agreements
• any relevant Requests for Expressions of Interest, Requests For Proposal (or equivalent calls for bids), responses to Requests for Expressions of Interest, letters of interest, responses to Requests for Proposal, sole source or limited source justification and approval documentation, documentation of selection, and other materials generated in the consideration and selection of the technology in question.

FINANCIAL and FUNDING MATERIALS
• Any records related to the financing or funding of this face recognition technology or system, including a copy of any related funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, grantor status/progress reports, purchase orders, invoices, and other memoranda and documentation related to the payment or cost (or lack thereof) of the face recognition technology or system, related technology, personnel, equipment, or other elements concerning this face recognition technology or system or program.

POLICIES, INSTRUCTIONAL, TRAINING, AND USE MATERIALS
• All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of face recognition technology or system. This includes any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of the software, any explanations (whether generated internally or externally) of how the face recognition technology or system works, and any other document that has been used to help explain the use of the face recognition technology or system to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.
• This also includes training materials governing the use, sharing, or access to the face recognition technology or system or any data related to or collected by the face recognition software/technology, including the legal standard that is required before using the technology.
• Please provide a copy of any policies, policy directives, guidance documents, memoranda, training materials, or similar records governing the use and function of this technology for immigration, law enforcement, or any purpose, including all those related to data retention, permissible and impermissible use, and security standards. This would include materials that describe the application, function, and use of the face recognition technology or system, including advertisements, emails, handouts, usage policies, PowerPoint presentations, specification documents, or standard operating procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Natalie Katsaros
